website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon AF-S Nikkor 70-200mm f/4G ED VR is the telezoom for Nikonians who can't handle the cost of the f/2.8 version of the lens.
cons: Tripod collar is an expensive add-on

customer_reviews.title: love using my lens, my best purchase of 2018
customer_reviews.text: Smitten with it since July 2018. Like many I tend to MF with AF macro lenses close-up but with this 105mm I can now routinely use AF even in low light (where the VR also helps) and results are fantastic. Not having to pay so much attention to technique allows me to give more to composition. Agree it's 5* My most treasured purchase of 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When you are able to understand this lense it is very good
customer_reviews.text: Service by seller fast and efficient. The lense is very detailed macro unit. Take your time to read the technical information to setup and use the lense and you will be well rewarded with some fantastic macro photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best lens ever !!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing !!!!! My best purchase of 2019, and first macro lens I’ve bought. Immediately was able to take incredible shots, and use of the manual focus is fairly simple even for macro beginners! If one prefers to autofocus, this does a bang on job!! AF is a bit clunky but it gets the job done. The shots are incredible and I can’t wait to try out some more!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: picture quality and vaue for money.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say about this lens is WOW!!!!! the macro pictures are mind blowing sharp ,it is also great for portrait photos and general photography top marks!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rex

customer_reviews.title: A great Macro/Prime/Portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a great piece of kit... I hesitated at first when buying this but took the plunge and haven't regretted it. Some of the macro shots I have taken have absolutely astounded me and have received great comments on twitter. It is a great all round lens taking exceptional portrait shots and acts as a wonderful prime lens. The only negative is that it hunts abit when focusing in low light, but that is soon cured by switching to manual mode, which I usually use. Just buy it, you wont regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dappa Don

customer_reviews.title: Mind Blowing Macro Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Real heavy duty Lens. Just the feel of the lens will blow your mind away! Picture quality is just fantastic! I bought a cheaper Tokina 100MM 2.8 thinking i can get by it, but the focus hunting thing made me mad! This has a manual overdrive and that just makes life so much more easy! If you are not on a FX body there are couple other choices. But i think this is just perfect for the FX body owners! Cheers :)
customer_reviews.author: Jishnu Nandy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Although I only received this lens this morning I am more than happy with the result. Good quality and excellent macro images. Also this lens was only ordered yesterday afternoon and due to the current virus situation I didn't expect delivery until later this week but it arrived this morning. Excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Very poor focal range and does not focus close in
customer_reviews.text: Very slow, really bad focus time and the focal range is very bad. Not impressed at all, will go for Tamron from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer.

customer_reviews.title: dream lenses
customer_reviews.text: holy grail lenses. Nikon had a cash back promotion so bought it from amazon. Absolutely dream! very sharp and takes fantastic shots! must have for any photographer. No wonder they are called holy grail. Heavy though but quality comes first!!Thanks Amazon and Nikon for making my dream come true.
customer_reviews.author: Tadas

customer_reviews.title: Best 70-200 range Lens
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between 70-200mm 2.8 and f4 after reading positives reviews i decided to go for f4 and really loved it iam not indoor photographer so i will use this lens outdoor and i dont need 2.8 nearly double the price and double the weight and i dont need tripod collar to use with my D800 as this lens is v light weight. Iam so happy that i picked up this lens. I always use amazon and their delivery package is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Mohsan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lovely clear photos taking on my Nikon D810 brilliant lens
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Superb for the job.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best Macro lens on the market. A little dearer than others but at the end of the day, you get what you pay for. You would not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D. English

customer_reviews.title: Waah! I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: What a lens! Love it. Sharp as a pin, wide max aperture, dream to focus with auto or manual focus. Minor prob is that it weighs a ton. However it balances beautifully on a tripod using the mount and the camera can just hang off the back no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really sharp lens
customer_reviews.text: Really sharp photos. A photograph of a fox visiting my garden is so sharp the detail of its nose would allow you to identify the fox as surely as a finger print identifies a person.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Booth

customer_reviews.title: Great midrange Zoom Lens
customer_reviews.text: Light weight so can hand hold Fast Autofocus Pictures sharp
customer_reviews.author: Tony L

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great lens, so sharp and great quality , with the Nikon D810
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Greig

customer_reviews.title: Decent tripod collar
customer_reviews.text: I had read reviews of poor plastic tripod collars with this product. But mine came with a very substantial cast alloy collar. I'm pleased I waited for it to arrive rather than order an alternative collar at the same time. Performed as expected for Nikkor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really amazingly sharp at a comfortable (so usable) weight
customer_reviews.text: Really amazingly sharp at a comfortable (so usable) weight, great colour and contrast and I don't miss f2.8 – on most creatures you will want to have more than just the eye in focus!
customer_reviews.author: snapparazzi

customer_reviews.title: fantastic lense
customer_reviews.text: great lense, a bit heavy, but worth the bad back, even better with the nikon D800. Rather expensive but worth it when you see your pictures, with all those extra setting you can have lots of fun
customer_reviews.author: mrs mac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase! This product met exceeded my expectations. Arrived on time. Performs very well after a prolonged use. Recommended to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S Nikkor 70-200mm
customer_reviews.text: This lens is better than I am, together with the D800 the results are jaw dropping and stunning. Contrast, biting sharp definition are outstanding, a jewel!
customer_reviews.author: The Prof.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Top lens - top delivery - would definitely use them again for all photographic products
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Gunter

customer_reviews.title: It's a fabulous lens and I would highly recommend it, both for macro work and portraiture
customer_reviews.text: Lens arrived 2 days after ordering it(I live in Ireland).It was a used lens but looks brand new.It's a fabulous lens and I would highly recommend it,both for macro work and portraiture.It's super sharp. Tom.
customer_reviews.author: Phototom

customer_reviews.title: Best Nikon Lens Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. It exudes quality in it's construction and the performance is phenomenal. Of the 13 Nikon branded lenses I own, this is my favourite.
customer_reviews.author: Jeppers

customer_reviews.title: one of my favourite lens.
customer_reviews.text: A truly superb epic elf craftsmanship, one of my favourite lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: Of course, doing what I do for a living I'm bound to love this lens, which replaced my almost 20-year-old version. Warning - if you have any microbes (used advisedly) on your sensor and opt for macro with maximum DoF, they will show up as this lens drops the effective aperture to f54.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: It's one of best macro lens
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this lens, so I knew what I buy. Pros: - very good mechanical quality - excellent resolution - VR - internal focusing, I like it. Con: - The lens is a little bit big and heavy, but it's not the most important feature for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Torilo

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens, build quality superb. I don't use this as a macro lens, but the portraits I take with it are razor sharp when mounted to my D800. No issue with focus speed, and yes it is a little heavy - but that's what good money pays for - quality.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible lens! it produces very sharp images and it is very well built, but too heavy. It is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic lens
customer_reviews.text: just got this and wow what a lens Absolutely fantastic its sharp all the way and gives great colour and detail
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A star performer for anyone with a full frame Nikon, so sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lens upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great lens even sharper than the old VR I had for years and this does the job and is faster!
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: This is a specific lens who hasnt disappointed!its perfect: expensive but worth it. Plus excellent delivery conditions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality as expected - high
customer_reviews.text: Lens quality may even be better than f2.8 version , and this is much lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Ryszard Ciesielski

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase..
customer_reviews.text: This lens is very good and the pictures are very sharp. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: theCoolCancerian

customer_reviews.title: A simply stunning lens
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the images from this lens makes it worth the weight and every penny of its price. My new favorite lens
customer_reviews.author: MR PAUL MULHOLLAND

customer_reviews.title: ... use this as me theatre lens and it is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as me theatre lens and it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: rolf evans

customer_reviews.title: A Great lense
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with this lens, very, very sharp, a real pleasure to use. Rather expensive but I have no regret in my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: another great Nikon lens
customer_reviews.text: It was a choice between the 70-200 f4 and the f2.8, I went for this over the F2.8 mainly due to the size and weight. It is very sharp and works perfectly on my D7000.
customer_reviews.author: S. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Top quality lens would reccoment it to anyone!
customer_reviews.text: fantastic. nice crisp images, super auto focus and amazing colour and contrast. I reccomend shooting with an aperture of at least f/8 for clean sharp pics.
customer_reviews.author: barneym

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S VR Micro NIKKOR 105mm f/2.8 IF-ED Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a cracking piece of kit! Image quality is superb, vibration reduction is very useful when hand holding and all in all I can't find a fault with it. Extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: PETER BOYD

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Yes....I have experienced what other people were saying, excellent product...worth the money that i have spent. Very sharp and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Eleftherios A.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice piece of kit that is very easy to use as either a macro lens or as a regular lens.
customer_reviews.author: PKNZ

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 105mm AF-S VR Lens
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur photographer and bought this lens for taking pictures of butterflies, plants, flowers and bugs!! I must say it was bigger than I expected and at first found it quite difficult to hold steady. Takes a bit of practice!! Tripods are great but some shots have no time to set them up. The quality of this lens is outstanding! All that I expect from a Nikon lens. If you can keep it still you can get fantastic shots. I am very pleased with it and an excellent buy! Would whole heartidly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tillett

customer_reviews.title: Superb lens but be prepared to build some muscles.
customer_reviews.text: the quality and feel of this lens is superb, but it is so heavy that you have to hold the lens more than the camera, or risk damaging the mount. It is very fast and the f2.8 aperture gives excellent low light performance. If you're looking at this, you may have to decide whether you would take this one or go for the new f4 one which is about half the weight, a bit quicker, and just as good, but loses out on the light grabbing capabilities of this lens. If you're looking at travelling a lot with this lens, you will almost certainly prefer the F4 version.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Close-ups and Blurry Backgrounds
customer_reviews.text: Changing my APS-C camera for a full-frame model got me in the mood to trade up from my 60mm Micro to this 105mm lens. The main benefits are that you don't need to get so close to the subject (so you don't scare creatures or cast your own shadow onto them) and that the 105mm lens has Vibration Reduction. The latter only works with more distant subjects but it makes it excellent for portraits, producing super-sharp subjects with creamy smooth out-of-focus backgrounds. Not cheap but definitely a quality lens.
customer_reviews.author: Pixal8

customer_reviews.title: Superb Lens
customer_reviews.text: If your thinking, that's a lot of money! Yes it is, but honestly, if it is a working lens then you will earn it back. The quality is astonishing, its build quality is pure Nikon in every way. Totally solid, brilliantly sharp and a nice weight. The VR function is great if you want to keep your ISO low and shoot at low speeds. I shot at 1/5 s and got a nicely sharp image - I am a steady shot mind you, so combine that with VR it's a winner for low light alongside a D700, D800, D3, D4 etc!! In the box you get a nice bag, the hood and cap as you would expect. Brilliant!!!
customer_reviews.author: Editor

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality glass
customer_reviews.text: This is the go to lens for Pro and serious ametuer Nikon shooters. I bought this for my D800 as it requires top quality glass to get the most from the camera's resolution. My 70-300 was ok on the D800 but not quite as sharp. I like the integral tripod collar ring and the build quality us amazing, but then you would expect that for the price.
customer_reviews.author: van de erekes

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this one of the best macro lenses I have used but is also a fantastic portrait lens. It,s 105mm focal length performs perfectly and at distance which doesn't, encroach on subject,s comfort zone. I am very happy indeed with it,s all-round performance in varied conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Telford

customer_reviews.title: A heavy piece of great optics
customer_reviews.text: I'll skip redundancy and just say that this is a great lens. With the D800 it's as good as it gets. Now, if you plan to shoot handheld, for which VR II is there to do the job, and it does, after one hour you'll definitely feel the need to do some previous workout. It's heavy. Of course, we get it because we plan to shoot handheld. Otherwise, a non-VR lens would do. This one requires a monopod if you're shooting for a long time. BTW, it's also great with the Nikon 1 system, and you get a really nice 540mm reach.
customer_reviews.author: ORLANDO HENRIQUES

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted this lens for yolks and eventually been able to afford it. Bloomin heavy (same as my Sigma 150-500) but after the first couple of shots - well worth it. I've had a 18-200 DX VR for a few year which is great, a bit wobbly at full stretch but v.good down the wide end. However this blows it away from 70 upwards. Not for the faint hearted with the weight and price. Going for the 28-70 2.8 next, can't wait!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Manaton

customer_reviews.title: wonderful portrait lens
customer_reviews.text: bought this after having a an old 70-200mmf2.8 vr1. this lens is lighter and for portraits, sharper. with DSLR and the high ISO you can use f4 is OK
customer_reviews.author: dcm

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens with fast autofocus.
customer_reviews.text: Pro quaility build and photos. Very fast (but not instant) autofocus. Fantastic vr even in really low light you can get really sharp images and also great for video.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Shanks

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S VR Micro NIKKOR 105mm f/2.8G IF-ED Lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a photographer and this is the opinion of someone who knows nothing about photography. If nothing else, this lense put this old lady on her knees crawling through the vegetation looking for bugs to snap and I have some very nice photo's, thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia van Heerden

customer_reviews.title: Superb lens
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lens around this focal length, but without the bulk and weight of the f/2.8. I was not disappointed when this arrived - it's light, but feels well built. I have only had it out once so far, but that was a test at British Superbikes. Coupled to a D7100 I had good, sharp results on 90% of the shots, not bad when the bikes are going through the corner at around 100mph.
customer_reviews.author: londonsean69

customer_reviews.title: as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have not spent much time with this lens yet but so far it has certainly lived up to my expectations.I think this lens is a worthwhile purchase and not just because I required a lens covering this range. It has great features and the ability to please I think its well worth its money.I find the autofocus very quickly which I like and the image stabiliser is a great thing for a shaky person like me.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Razor Sharp
customer_reviews.text: After looking at various Macro Lenses I plumped for this purely on the reviews read on here. I was not disappointed. The Lens delivers excellent results and is so versatile...Macro to Portraiture. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love my new 105mm
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant, the quality of the lens is outstanding. Shot of wasp was taken at less than 20 cm on quite a windy day, weather was slightly overcast. f14, 1/640, iso 250.
customer_reviews.author: M LANT

customer_reviews.title: Great macro lens
customer_reviews.text: It took a while for me to get used to it, finding a balance between DOF and subject, but the main thing is stability. I am still waiting for my tripod, but I did find some rocks or pieces of wood to stabilize the camera (D610) and take some fantastic macro shots. It's also a great portrait lens, btw. And even from mid-distance the quality is amazing. Great colour depth.
customer_reviews.author: Wim De Weerdt

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Ditto to all of the positive reviews. Impressed already with its first outing. Fast, accurate, excellent build, feels reliable, tough, versatile. I have it on a Nikon d810 as I wanted to match it's fx capability and has already proved itself.
customer_reviews.author: Sawboy

customer_reviews.title: great lens
customer_reviews.text: expensive,but i use it for photography at non league football matches,married to a 7100,it takes excellent pictures, with great bokeh at the 2.8 setting.also as the 7100 is a dx camera,i can reach the other end of the ground at approx 300mm with marvellous clarity.[105mm-297mm]compared to my old olympus ep-l1 14-150mm,the lowlight performance is brilliant,with little post editing required.would recommend if possible the use of at least a monopod,as this outfit is heavy,if you have the funds highly recommended,also if you upgrade to fx this will make use of the extra pixels available.
customer_reviews.author: davjhedges

customer_reviews.title: Picture perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this lens a professional photographer told me that it is quite heavy. Other reviews criticised the lens hood and the tripod mount bracket. Nothing in this world is perfect but this lens is amazingly good, fast quiet, sharp and great colour rendition, I am delighted with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Gowans

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding image quality
customer_reviews.text: This lens produces excellent image quality, even wide open. It is much lighter than its f2.8 brother but a very good alternative for those wanting a smaller, lighter package and not needing the extra speed. Ideal for landscape photography. It is light enough not to need a tripod collar, but independent collars are available if you prefer to have one.
customer_reviews.author: mistymornings

customer_reviews.title: Quality buy
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research and debating whether to go for the slightly cheaper Sigma version of this lens I decided on the Nikkor and am absolutely delighted with my choice. It has fast become my favourite lens. Solid build, fast focus and pin sharp images, what more could you wish for.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Haslam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand and use plenty of reviews on this ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Lens a while back. For my needs which is shooting my Fly Tying efforts in mini studio macro set up. Quite simply, you get what you pay for, this lens has given me superb results. Easy to understand and use plenty of reviews on this lens on youtube. Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: ADBF

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant photos edge to edge and first photos without a ...
customer_reviews.text: Just tried this lense out on my D5300 and what should I say. As the old saying goes ' You get what you pay for ' and in this case very accurate. Brilliant photos edge to edge and first photos without a Tripod. The price brings the results, very pleasing to see a Lense work in the way described by Nikon. Happy Bunny. R.B.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Rook

customer_reviews.title: One of the best lenses Nikon has ever made and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: A crisp sharp lens from 80mm to 400mm on a Nikon D610. Even hand held "snapshots" of the moon are clean and sharp. The motor is incredibly fast for such a big lens. Switching the D610 to DX mode makes this lens 600mm and the images are still sharp with very little or no colour fringe. One of the best lenses Nikon has ever made and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it. My photography has improved a lot because ...
customer_reviews.text: Superb lens . I absolutely love it . My photography has improved a lot because of the quality images that this lens will give you ...
customer_reviews.author: david bird

customer_reviews.title: Good lens
customer_reviews.text: certainly a big step up from its predecessor, but with the D750 I had trouble getting sharp images utilising the VR. I've since learned this camera has issues with certain VR lenses, which eas allegedly fixed in a firmware update. The sharp images I did obtain were superb, excellent sharpness and contrast up to 350mm, then a little drop at the top end.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Macro photo
customer_reviews.text: Nikon 105mm is excellent for macro photography, but also a lens you can recommend for portraits. A good buy, at good price
customer_reviews.author: Rolf Johansson

customer_reviews.title: Good lens, but vveeeeery heavy
customer_reviews.text: Good lens, but vveeeeery heavy! And I still think that the fault for the bad quality photos has nothing to do with the lens ;) I still have much to learn. ....bit pricey as well.
customer_reviews.author: sonicspot

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 105 mmm Macro
customer_reviews.text: A very good lens for close ups and portraits. I took a close up of my PC screen and I can see the individual colour pixels clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Michdael P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens but heavy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great lens that’s very sharp and is as happy doing macro as portraits. The lens feels solid and very well built and is heavy, came with soft case and lens hood. It was a toss up between this and the Nikon 85mm macro but after reading reviews I went for this not realising the weight (I have arthritis in my hands) thought I could get used to it but decided to go with the 85mm macro as it’s much lighter and am much happier with that. The 105mm is a brilliant lens just not for me so will probably sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan JS

customer_reviews.title: Quality lens
customer_reviews.text: a quality update from the old film camera lens that I still possess
customer_reviews.author: Delphas

customer_reviews.title: Wrong or missing accessories.
customer_reviews.text: This lens was delivered with a 62mm lens cap not the correct 67mm. The lens was also delivered without a lens hood. The lens was also delivered without a soft lens bag. None of the above were verified in the item description. The lens itself is magnificent.
customer_reviews.author: Tug Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. My husband has had better pics since owning this lenses. Deff recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good lense, but not had chance to use it much until warmer weather. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lens !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Quick focus,sharp producing very good quality picture but heavy and expensive but all in all worth that money. I Highly Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chalupa

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Sharp images, fast AF, lightweight. On a D800e it is outstanding. Works great with the 1.4 extender. Could be the only long focal length lens you'll ever need. Update. I'm using this with a TC 1.4x extender and this should be giving me 560mm, but I'm not convinced it does. It feels much shorter. With the TC it's maximum aperture is f8. It's very soft. By contrast it gets very sharp if stopped down to f11. AF works reasonably well at f11.
customer_reviews.author: Justice Peace

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd add this, since no one else had so far. My copy of this lens is made in China and workmanship and operation are still top notch. Bravo Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: MAL

customer_reviews.title: VR NOT REPAIRABLE
customer_reviews.text: Great lens - very sharp! Unfortunately the VR broke / stopped working just after 1 year only / out of warranty ... so I toke it to Nikon who wanted to charge £850 for repair. I was so puzzled by this ... basically it's designed so tightly it can NOT be repaired or replace that VR part... they have to replace the entire lense! I felt robbed and angry at Nikon ... it s however s great lens, light, sharp... would I get another one, maybe not - maybe the Tamron G2 70-200.
customer_reviews.author: R.Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Picture, description & comments indicate 2.8G whereas title 2.8D?
customer_reviews.text: The picture, description and comments indicate this lens is 2.8G IF-ED whereas item's title it's a 2.8D - could you please let me know which lens did you get and whether it's the latest G version compatible with D700? I have already ordered it then spotted the title so hope it's the 2.8G ID-ED VR. Many thanks, David
customer_reviews.author: adventura_dot_com

customer_reviews.title: Very nice - fast focusing and sharp pictures
customer_reviews.text: Have used this to photo wildlife and like it very much. It's fast at focusing and works a treat on my D7100. The only (very small) gripe is that the lens collar for tripod attachment might be a bit small and has no handle. I had to replace mine with an Arca swiss type Kirk Enterprises one for use on a gimbal head.
customer_reviews.author: Jeppers

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: There is not much to add - this lens is awesome. Very positive reviews by Ken Rockwell or dpreview and other sites that have more in depth reviews.
customer_reviews.author: adventura_dot_com

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent lens. Highly recommended. Prompt delivery abroad by Amazon; neatly packed
customer_reviews.author: Peter vdL

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Nikkor 105mm
customer_reviews.text: It's Nikon, I have other Nikkor lenses, I expected it to be good, and it is. Can't wait to upgrade my DSLR :)
customer_reviews.author: mlpoole

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S 80-400 f4.5-5.6 G ED VR LENS
customer_reviews.text: This lens is very sharp if you stop it from moving focus ,which none of my pro lens do, the other fault is the poor collar ,which is too small and for this price , should not flex, so I think I will now purchase the kirk quick release collar from the states when I visit next year as this is not available in the uk, the focus problem is due to low light levels and a slow f stop, as I am used to f2-8 lenses
customer_reviews.author: mr l m reid

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Lens, but read on if you are confused about VR and VRII
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lens from Amazon as it was advertised as a VRII in the product description. Its actually labelled on the box and on the lens as a VR lens, however the supporting documentation inside the box does refer to it being the latest VRII technology. This confused me as I thought Amazon had initially sent me the wrong lens. Now the confusion is over, I'm keeping the lens, however have not yet had a chance to use it. I hope this makes things clearer for other buyers, as my initial disapointment is now resolved. I'm massive fan of Nikon lenses, so am sure I wont be disapointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Fitter Dad

customer_reviews.title: I'm super irritated with this lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm super irritated with this lens. I bought it initially in January 2014 and after a month or two had intermittent focus issues. I sent this back to Amazon who dealt with this problem really quickly and efficiently, I have no issue with Amazon, but 8 months down the line I now have the same problem with this lens AGAIN! Maybe I should defect to Canon after all!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Faulty lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens from Amazon because it has brilliant reviews from many sources and was cheaper than the local Nikon agent. However the auto focus on mine stopped working within a couple of weeks. Unfortunately Amazon could not supply a replacement for at least 4 to 8 weeks. This is much too late for my needs, so I have no option other than a refund upon return. I shall be purchasing a replacement from Calumet.
customer_reviews.author: P Glover

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great for macro so clear and the colours are brilliant . A great lens over all and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 70-200mm f/4G ED VR Lens
product_meta.description:
Size Name:70-200 mm f/4GOne stop further: The next-generation Vibration Reduction system incorporated in this lens allows for up to 5-stop compensation, enabling photographers to shoot at shutter speeds five stops slower than would otherwise be possible. A significant upgrade, the increased stability greatly minimises the effects of camera shake and extends opportunities for low-light shooting.

Superb resolution and image quality: Despite its lightweight build, this lens doesn't cut any corners when it comes to performance. Crafted to deliver outstanding resolution and contrast in diverse conditions, the optical construction boasts 20 elements in 14 groups, and Nikon's Nano Crystal Coat is employed to combat flare and ghosting.

Highly Versatile: Well-balanced in terms of size, weight, price and image quality, this lens also has a dedicated tripod collar ring, the RT-1. This optional accessory helps to improve tripod balance and allows quick, smooth transition between vertical and horizontal orientation when shooting in either portrait or landscape format.

Hiro Sebata, Product Manager for professional products at Nikon UK says: "This new NIKKOR f/4 lens offers high quality performance and flexibility, ideal for enthusiast and professional photographers looking for a versatile, portable tele-photo lens, with the added benefit of the enhanced Vibration Reduction system."

BOX CONTAINS
AF-S NIKKOR 70-200mm f/4G ED VR Lens
Lens Hood
Lens Pouch
feature_bullets: The AF-S NIKKOR 70–200mm f/4G ED VR extends Nikon's range of high-performance f/4 NIKKOR lenses.
It is the first NIKKOR to be equipped with Nikon's next-generation Vibration Reduction system that allows for up to 5-stop compensation.

Well suited to events, travel, wildlife and sports, the strong combination of extended vibration reduction capability and high-grade Nikon optics makes this lens a smart choice for enthusiast photographers and professionals alike.
Optimized for edge-to-edge sharpness on both FX- and DX-format D-SLRs

specifications.Included Components: LF-4 Rear Lens Cap, AF-S FX NIKKOR 70-200mm f/4G ED Vibration Reduction Zoom Lens for Nikon DSLR Cameras, LC-67 Snap-on Front Lens Cap, HB-60 Bayonet Lens Hood, CL-1225 Semi-soft Lens Case
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,598 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
